summary: When gypsy grifter Matko (Bajram Severdzan) is abruptly swindled by his own partner, he is unable to pay the large debt he suddenly owes. As an alternative form of payment, Matko forces his adolescent son Zare (Florijan Ajdini) into an arranged marriage with his partner's midget sister, Afrodita (Salija Ibraimova). However, both Zare and Afrodita find the marriage objectionable, and their attempts to escape the situation lead to a series of unpredictable comic escapades.

reviews.content: Madness and happiness in every minute. The style of its director seems very peculiar to me. 7/10
A Balkan gypsy comedy by the true master, so full of colour, life, music, bizarre characters and scenes, it's nothing but a joy to absorb.
True comedy. Great movies are made of details.
"To go beyond is as wrong as to fall short," So yes, a bit too much of... everything! I like Kusturica style but this is not as good as good as his other works.
I love that the surrealism brings the reality to life. Behind all the crazy stuff happening with the cocaine and the guns and the midgets there is the gypsy culture and some pure love stories.

Black Cat, White Cat has its moments as some scenes are quite memorable, but otherwise it's a mess. Although well shot and well scored per usual for a Kusturica movie, it features all of his worst tendencies - ridiculous, implausible plot points, annoying humor, underdeveloped characters and a lack of any point, themes or message to it whatsoever. He literally here copied the worst of Fellini's works.
Incredible, hilarious and bizarre!! A must watch.
A true jewel - art movie and a comedy-rarely successful combo.
This movie is really funny if you can watch a movie that doesn't speak English. Yeah the only way you can understand this movie without subtitles unless you can speak the language.

I've had this film laying around for nearly ten years I think. Never picked it until now, still with great expectations.

This is a very fresh film. As the small time hustlers, their families and connections get's into trouble with more successful gangsters things get into a real farce. Poverty and the constant search for cash is important here. So is the value of family and love.

There is comedy involved everywhere, among the characters and their choices especially. The gypsy setting makes it even more interesting - all that music everywhere, it felt like "Gogol Bordello" was in my living room.

It's lovely shot and it got a very original and fresh look. Very inventing and full of fresh ideas. Still, this was not as good as I was hoping for. Firstly it was way too long. It felt dragged out, since it's plotwise pretty slowly moving. Secondly it was rearly really funny and for the third matter it was a bit safe - it was never dearing enough like a movie like this shold be. A good film, a very memorable one and I'm glad I saw it. I wanted a whole lot more though.

6.5 out of 10 sun flower fields.
Very funny, but also dense and artfully staged in its slapstick. Branka Katic has an impressive command of her body for maximum comedy.
Life's a joke. What a delightful and energetic cinematic experience!
Eccentric, Dark, Insanely Funny.
Wonderful, funny movie. Seen it a bunch of times, and given it as a gift to many friends.

A coke-snorting small-town gangster offers to let a scheming loser out of a debt if his son marries the mobster's daughter. Heavy on plot and with lots of quirky characters, this plays like a script Leonard Elmore might have written if he's been born a Bosnian gypsy.
A macskajaj egy furcsa és undorító film, mégis megvan a szépsége.
A farceful look at the joy of life of a Yugoslavian Gypsy settlement on the banks of the Danube. Lovely characters played by mostly non-professional actors/actresses, can't stop smiling all the way.
Mad hatter anarchic fun

I saw this film 14 years too late! It was like a gypsy "Pulp Fiction" with ten times more depths and characterization then the latter. This is an extremely quirky film, riddled with crazy caricatures of East European mafiosi and small time crooks. It sports some of the most imaginative characters I have ever seen on a screen (a woman who pulls nails with her buttocks?) and some of the most bizarre scenes.And yet the film is beautifully balanced, never falling into outright lunacy or losing the plot.

The scenes are at times almost nostalgic, a throwback to some simpler time when you could just have fun, no holds barred. And that is exactly what this film does for me - I have not had as much fun in ages. You will leave the theater with a feel-good factor 10 and thank out loud the people who created this gem.

Kusturica is a phenomenon.

Black Cat White Cat - Divine Comedy
A gangster wiping excrement of his body using a goose..... The same gangster juggling hand grenades and gyrating to a thumping Techno number while being snow blinded silly....
A pig chewing through an abandoned car, a wraith like Godfather eternally fixated on Casablanca and his custom made wheel chair.... Gypsies, mesmerism, contraband trade, tourines, limos and 'stoned wall' moles...
Conspiracies, serendipity, cultural erosion, brotherhood, true love and forgiveness color this laugh menagerie by Emir Kusturica. 
Black Cat White Cat bears the same Molieresque drama and the same Shakespearan elements that doff a hat to Kustrica's earlier works like Underground and Time of the Gypsies, but takes its own riotous, rabble rousing  course. 
For me, the exact gap between familiarity and intrigue was one scene. And it is pretty much Kusturica's genius that wrongfoots the viewer into complacency before a stray element comes along - segueing in, surprising us and walking away in sarcastic victory. 
The black cat white cat motif is not just a stoic symbol relating to a few characters in the film. Kusturica develops this symbol with the ever changing tone of the film. If at one point the cats are being cursed, at another they become the vehicles of rebirth. If at one point they indulge in sprite like mischief, at another they become important witnesses in an impromptu wedding aboard a rebel sail boat. 
Black Cat White Cat is a director's movie: to the hilt. Whether it is the amazing range of performances, the technical fluidity or the writing chops on display, Kusturica exercises amazing control over the varying tone throughout. A myriad issues are dealt with but an overwhelming Joie de Vivre permeates every scene in the film, performed with a wild, kinetic energy. Indeed the spirit is infectious, transporting the viewer effortlessly from pure Surrealism to self mocking humaneness an  finally an awe inspiring charm. 
At the centre of all this heart-warming bedlam is a cleverly constructed core that gives the film much of its quirkiness. Like the carousel in the film, the plot is structured on seven to eight major scenes varying in tone from insane slapstick to edifying sensuality. Each of the scenarios in turn branches off into various threads, packing in diverse themes and conflicts. Kusturica mixes and matches, stirs and shakes ingredients in such a fashion that leaves one in a razzled state of blood rushed state of sugary indulgence. 



Like many of its contemporaries. Black Cat White Cat is a polemic with a sprawling scope, designed as a Divine Comedy embracing hallowed cinematic idioms. 
The narrative begins with an illegal barter between a middle aged slacker, Matko and inmates aboard a Russian fuel tanker. On being swindled, Matko hatches a plot to strike diesel supplies on board a Russian train. He seeks the help of a local don, Grga, who we discover owes a moral debt to Matko's father. Matko's indiscretion results in him revealing the plan and in turn being double crossed by Dady (Dayan) a war profiteer and man of means. The scoundrel Dadi also ensnares Matko to pledge his son's (Zare) hand in marriage to Dadi's plain sister, Lady Bug Aphrodita. Zare is in turn in love with Ida, the free spirited granddaughter of a gypsy woman. 
Kusturica enriches this simple tableau with idioms that we have come to love, accept and expect from complete movie experiences. Much of what the movie accomplishes is because it achieves what it sets out to do; get us to laugh at a torn nation learning to laugh at its mistakes and past experiences. 
Grga and Matko's dad represent the Old World Order, of say Tito's perhaps. Dadi and Matko represent the noise and confusion of the post Genocide years. Zare and Ida represent the Future - 'in a land with no sun,' as one character puts it. 
Each of these characters undergo a rite of passage - the moribund patriarchs have to literally defy Death, liberate themselves and again court Death in that order - Dadi discovers his in a shit pit and Matko experience his finally after being swindled a third time. 
The music is worthy of standing on its own merit: Beethoven jostles with river side violinists who contend with drunken wedding bands plastered on clover trees. 
Kusturica kicks up a storm with his ensemble of animal performers: the chewing pig. trains of cackling geese, expressive goats and horses to the all pervading harbingers - the black and white cats, and not to forget, a mouse in a rotating wheel. 
I can't think of enough reasons for one to give this film a try....
-	Possibly the greatest love making/ seduction scene with not even a hint of physicality involved
-	Possibly the finest convergence of Caricature and Psychological sketch, especially in the characters of the frail Patriarchs
-	A serendipitious energy that guides almost every character in the film and even the more the audience. Sample this....a midget finds true love in a seven foot giant who with a double set of teeth is "as elegant as a vampire and has shovels for hands."



-	The Black and White cats that appear as Detiny's instruments throughout - right from when they are sneaky intruders to when they are involved in an act of resurrection.
-	A pastiche of unforgettable set pieces.....the walking tree stump, the moving gift box, the entire train robbery sequence and every time old boss Grga appears on screen.
About two years ago, I recall an Indian director citing Kusturica as a favorite influence. The occasion was his film being selected for a Cannes screening. I am glad that Kusturica's vision is rubbing off on a generation of progressive Indian film makers. 
On a wishful detour, I hope that more of my countrymen can experience Black Cat White Cat. It is the perfect film for the average Indian film goer's psyche....
-	It is loud, colorful escapism but it also gives you Intellectual tokens, if you ask.
Black Cat White Cat is a sparkling achievement to Kusturica's luminous filmography and a milestone in the rich East European film legacy.
"My soul is on fire !" :)
Se me hizo un poco larga pero en general me gustÃ³.
The most absurd movie I've ever seen. In the style of Emir Kusturica. A genius.
What a brilliantly bizarre thing to watch on a snowy friday night!

Never before has a farce stirred so many emotions...
Just dont miss it...
Esplosivo, serratissimo, un po' pulp un po' felliniano, in salsa gitana. Coinvolgente.
Unique movie with a lot of humor. One of the best movies of Srdjan Todorovic where he shows his talent. In one sentence, a movie that will give you great time for two hours.
Incredible, entertaining. And timeless - I can see my self enjoying this movie when I'm 40, or 50 or...yeah you get it.

Watched 'BLACK CAT, WHITE CAT', a film by EMIR KUSTURICA. Absolutely enjoyable. I could never really figure out how an age old mediocre story transforms into a moving and innovative ride?:) and how an absolute classic and innovative story ends up into trash?:(

This one is into safe hands:) an absolute firecracker:) Funny and metaphoric:) ALIVE:)
This old school ghost story is an eerie and effective  concoction that blends theatrical flare with Japanese folklore.

Si Zivot je cudo (La vie est un miracle) m'avait atrocement déçu, d'autant plus que certains le considéraient comme étant le chef-d'oeuvre par excellence de Kusturica, Black cat, White cat est, pour sa part, un réel succès. S'apparentant presque à mon amour pour Underground, l'enivrement que j'ai ressenti tout au long du film m'a totalement charmé, et je ne peux que rêver lorsque je repense à toutes ces musiques envoûtantes, à ces métaphores visuelles éclatantes qui ne laissent jamais de répit au public, à ces personnages qui nous font tant rire et sourire! Car oui, Black cat, White cat est d'abord et avant tout une comédie, contrairement à l'aspect un tantinet dramatique de Underground, et il est évident que le cinéma serbe prend encore davantage d'ampleur dans mes goûts personnels. Il n'y a plus de doute: Kusturica est un Dieu.

A wild, energetic comedy with an appealingly ramshackle aesthetic from fascinating filmmaker, Emir Kusturica.
Want a band tied to a tree? For no reason? Here you go! And, by the way, a pig eating a car is highly relevant (at least for it's [the car's] owner).
Emir Kusturica's delightful praise of gypsy life on the Danubian, a colorful poetic comedy.
This movie is hilarious! So, so funny! Amazing soundtrack too. Kusturica best movie.

Mayhem from start to finish. The bones of the story are not new, but the discordant chaos with which it is delivered is gorgeously refreshing. Apparently I'm not allowed to buy the soundtrack. Highly recommended
Crazy, baffling, brilliant
Definitely one of the best movies I have seen in the recent months!
Absolutely love this movie!  It's incredibly funny!
Now here's something that you don't see every day!
amazing, crazy and very funny :)

All well, ends well too=
Totally hilarious.. 
Can't stop laughing until the ending..

ridiculous, hilarious from start to finish. you'll be humming 'Pitbull, Terrier' for weeks afterwards, and that experience alone is worth seeing the film for. plus one of the actors looks like him off herman dune.
Quirky, filled with interesting characters and somewhat strange storylets. Generally a bunch of fun to watch.
He visto pocas películas tan vitalistas como ésta, o tan caóticas, o tan absurdas. Kusturica no se puede explicar, hay que vivirlo. Muy recomendable para quienes amen la imaginación desatada.
Pretty funny film with likeable characters especially the main character who sports a 1996 Villa Shirt for a good half hour of the film. I suppose this is like a Serbian "Snatch"
Very strange, chaotic, and one of the funniest movies I have seen. The entire movie is very irreverent and earnest, and therein lies the movie's charm.
one of the best films i saw
Se me hizo un poco larga pero en general me gustÃ³.
For me this is a movie that I can see over and over again. Humor, twists, music all genious.
Cats, goats , geese and a car eating pig and a Casablancaesque end. What more can u ask for
5-Stars!!! this is a hillarious comedy with some crazy charachters and lots of love from director Emir Kustrica.

Intense, chaotic, wild, represents the mentality of both the gypsies and the land they inhabit. 
Kao i uvek Kusturica je genijalan. Njegovi filmovi definisu zivot.
Kusturica is a genius.
One of the best comedies that I ve seen. So colourful and crowded movie of Gypsies
Raucous black comedy about true love and corruption that tries to prevent it as a very good time.  Full of absurdities large and small in the service of what turns out to be a very sweet premise.

Che bel film, un film felice e ad elevatissimo tasso alcolico.
Piu' moscio nella prima parte, nella seconda prende un ritmo travolgente, frenetico e divertente. Grande Kusturica!

Chat noir chat blanc commence de facon trÃ¨s chaotique avec tout ce qui m'Ã©nerve dans le cinÃ©ma de Kusturica. Puis tout se met en place et le film devient franchement hilarant. Et il faut bien reconnaÃ®tre que le monsieur est virtuose avec une camÃ©ra...

simpaticissimo film, molto piacevole. Must di Kustorica. Apprezzato, consigliabile sotto effetto di stupefacenti, cosÃ¬ da entrare in linea con il fratello della sposa pazzo. Allucinante la scena del maiale che si mangia una macchina.

a bit irving welsh, and a bit good tarantino, a bit only fools and horses... total quality comedy with fantastic bright and energetic gypsy setting on the danube. What a hoot! Just watched it again, having seen some other Kusturica films since. It made more sense this while... and made me think more of Tarantino, perhaps. I think I prefer Life is a Miracle, because the farcical pace doesn't really have a dark side in this one - not so much the Black Cat. On the other hand, it works beatifully. Need to try Time of the Gypsies next.
I just love this movie!! My favorite by Kusturica. It is ultimately enjoyable, very funny and like every Kusturica movie, it simply makes you optimistic!
Couldn't even finish it.

Ecxellent movie in a funny view of how the gypsy people from that region live(sure its pretty fiction but...). The photography of this have his ups and downs but is purely touching when it have to be.

Instant classic: great non-story, great language, great characters, great actors, great music.
Barking mad and bit hyperactive, but really funny and beautifully shot.

Kusturica merite sa celebrite parce que, grace a son talent cinematographique pur, il est arrive a donner ses lettres de noblesse a la loufoquerie, que beaucoup d'autres realisateurs ont pour sujet mais sans atteindre la meme qualite, de loin !

This is a totally hilarious and outrageous comedy about Danube gypsy life and the blackest of black economies. The plot involves the purchase of a smuggled trainload of oil and a manic coke-snorting gangster who juggles hand grenades and is desperate to marry off his midget sister. The whole is accompanied by a marvellous soundtrack of Gypsy music.  Oh, and you need a good ear for languages as the characters switch between  Romani, Serbian, and Bulgarian: best rely on the sub-titles.
KIKIRIKI GUBAMALLA LOL
Crazy and awesome comedy that wants you to rewatch it afterwards. The music accompanying the movie is just wild and matches everything.
If ever you are depressed,this movie has the magic to keep you happy for 3 days.Watch it to know what happiness is.
Pure Gypsy comedy...

Just absolutely batsh*t crazy. Like sitting in the park with tramps all day drinking meths and then rolling up to a wedding or three. It all becomes a bit of a blur. A farce literally kept from falling in on itself by the speed and urgency of it's madness. Exhausting but entertaining too.

Demenziale, visionario, geniale! Uno dei film piÃ¹ divertenti che abbia mai visto, ben scritto e ben diretto, accompagnato da musiche gitane fuori da ogni canone. Grazie a Giacomo per l'ottimo consiglio ;-)
One of the best Kusturica movies!
favourite Yugoslav film and cartoon adaptation
there are not many movies like this in the world....very funny non stop journey with a happy endng!

"Nice" and "cute" always struck me as generic compliments you pay to those objects which are as inoffensive as they are forgettable. But I'm finding it hard to come up with higher-sounding praise for a movie I actually enjoyed quite a bit, so I'll just say that it was REALLY nice and REALLY cute, not to mention a lot of fun...

Favorite things: the pig slowly devouring an abandoned car over the course of the film, the old gypsy gangster addicted to Casablanca, and what is destined to become a eurodance classic, "Pitbull": http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zRvVzGR9RUc
Welcome to Balcan. Everything is possible and allowed. :D
Really cool comedy!!!

The sunny side of Balcan gypsy life had me wanting to exist in that fairy-tale world for years after viewing this film.
Heck, i still have a crush on the blond-haired, blue-eyed Branka Katic, and she's not even a gypsy. Though the movie's a comedy first, not a hard hitting portait of reality, to me it still has grit. A film celebrating youth, love amidst the crazy whirpool of disorder, and corruption in the countryside slums of former yugoslavia.

lovely characters and some really well done atmosphere full of both light-heartedness and everyday tragedies. one to be seen over and over again.

The characters are all one and one , the plot is hilarious , the backgrounds are shocking and memorable ,the soundtrack and background sounds are really funny.And Zare's adolescent love ...
For some reason "Pit Bull" and "Daddy, don't ever die on a Friday" (from the soundtrack) stud on my mind for a very very long time .

The Gypsy life in a nice, funny view.
Pretty scenes of the lives of gypsies on the banks of the Danube. More quirky Yugoslavian culture from Kusturica.
Hilarious romantic comedy, fantastic soundtrack.
The story has very few suprises, but the atmosphere in which it is told is just so different from what I am used to. And it has some fairly good jokes.

niet co dodat emir kusturica je genius, ci uz ide o vazny film, alebo komediu. Bravo majstre
There's definitely something in there to make anyone laugh!

Although I'm against heterosexism, marriage in general, and "love conquers all" stories, I really liked this movie a lot. Maybe it was mostly because it was about Rom, or maybe just because it was a great movie.
Completely unforgetable. Brilliant music. Madly sureal.

Excellent Balkan movie. Also know as Crna maèka, beli maèor. The actors speak Romani, Bulgarian and Serbocroatic. Its a romantic comedy telling about two Roma criminals who give each others children in mariage. The movie is located on the banks of the river Danube in eastern Serbia.

razi cu lacrimi!!!!!!!
it's closer to home in more ways that one.

Yeah, what a colourful and joyous thing this is. Makes me happy every time I see it!
so funny and absurd and awesome. such a shame i didn't get around to watching it till now.
this is a good movie, but you need subtitles to watch it. my grandma had to translate the movie for me
Amazing film. Hilarious, and ingenious.
if U want to know how to remove a nail from a timber, watch this awesome movie
Outstandingly hilarious...perfect timing by every character...
I'm not a big fan of this film... It's funny and okay-ish, but that's about it. I think from this film on Kusturica's career just went downhill. His earlier works are so much better.
Funny and totally absurd comedy about love (marriage) and family. Watch it if you like folky music, imaginative stories and shots of a pig eating a car.

This movie will always be in my top five because it combines so many elements that I love in movies: a healthy dose of sur-realism, extremely original story, absolutely hilarious, characters that develop throughout the movie, subtle cultural references that are probably lost on many,  fantastic music and beautifully shot.   Highly recommended.
weird stuff, very loveable
I personaly didn't find this comedy funny at all. But thanks to the enjoyable music and cinematography, it wasn't total waste of time either.
An ode to chaos... I'd give 5 stars if only the first part wouldn't be so slow... And the music is amazing. Kusturica is a genius
my godness, save me from all this madness!!! ;
I really enjoyed watching this film and the music was fantastic. What a bunch of great characters. Loved it!
Una de las pelis mÃ¡s raras que he visto pero vale la pena!

Una sinfonia de imagenes, una composicion exquisita. Musica en el 90% de la pelicula, una pelicula larga que se toma con soda, y muuuucho licor, Personajes bizarros y grandes escenarios gitanos, solo como kusturica los defiende y muestra... Cada plano cuidado y la orquesta que esta presente en cada pelicula. La mejor de Kustu
Great slapstick! A favourite of mine.
Incredible, entertaining. And timeless - I can see my self enjoying this movie when I'm 40, or 50 or...yeah you get it.
It certainly is absurd, so much so that I'm not sure if I loved it or hated it.

Au premier degre, un film plein de vie, de joie(s) et un hymne a la musique tsigane qui rend heureux. Mais certaines blagues et situations sont metaphoriques et Kusturica y fait le constat amer d'une Serbie d'apres-guerre malmenee par la generation des quarantenaires, et que les jeunes doivent fuir. Rien de reprehensible, pas d'imposture a l'horizon, n'est-ce pas Mr Finkielkraut ? :-)

Du pur Kusturica : baroque, drole, inventif, decale, absurde, profond, bref du pur genie. Les interpretations sont tout aussi reussies, et la musique est bien evidemment inoubliable. On pourrait croire ce film leger, mais il est en realite tres travaille. Du bonheur a l'etat pur et sans aucune mechancete, les gangsters etant ici punis de maniere burlesque et sans barbarie inutile (cfr la scene des toilettes !)

Excelentew
es la primera pelicula de Kusturica que veo
y me gusto, el humr, las historias, la mÃºsica, la ambientaciÃ³n, todo
recomendada totalmente
Hilariante, excêntrico, exuberante. Uma experiência cinematográfica inolvidável.
Heerlijke film, zou deze kunnen blijven herbekijken.
Una genialidad de lo absurdo...

So so hilarious! Wonderful film where extraordinary events seem to revolve around equally extraordinary characters! Black cat, white cat is simply overflowing with ridiculous ideas, contraptions, images and eccentric individuals and it's all just the background which emphasizes the importance of friendship and true love! A peculiar experience!

this is my second kusturica film and though it wast as good as underground, it was certainly as madcap. there is a surreal style that is reminscient of jean paul januet (sp? amelie director). odd vibrant colors and profound overacting make his films very interesting and funny. definetely pretty good though. some very funny bits

Otra de las cosas maravillosas del cine es la posibilidad de conocer diferentes culturas y diversas formas de ver el mundo y en eso Emir Kusturica  es un genio.
La música es un excelente bonus
love all of Kusturicas films and can watch them over and over.
An enchanting Balkan comedy. Wonderful characters, story, and cinematography - accompanied by gypsy music.
Fabulous fun and increasingly unusual. Recommended for those who like their films quirky.

I notice how different but equal and opposite but the same the events are here as they are portrayed and enacted in this film when compared to how they might play out in the ol' occupied U.S. states, or any other country where family and marriage is a major element in life. For that matter. My favorite aspect of the film was to see the way laughs were constructed and set up. For example, the gypsy band being tied to the tree and still playing their instruments, the  non-stop presence of geese herds filing in and out of the action, the weird mutation of western progress and especially film influencing the traditional desires of the main characters. After all, marriage was the point of the story. I think. Too bad Im not Russian because I think, as it was mentioned below, it does take one to know one fully. I can only speculate and inquire.
very funny movie. watched it several times, still enjoying every minute of it!
This movies *does not* reveal "some deep mystery of life", like you might expect from Kusturica. It's pure (and beautifully filmed) comedy that delivers what most other comedies promise.

This is still my all time favorite. The story reads like a book. All of the characters develop. It's unbelievably funny and charming as well. The only downside is that it's subtitled. Some of the characters speak Serbian and the Gypsies speak Romani. I love the sounds of both languages. It's possibly the funniest movie that I've ever seen.
